title: Ninety Six Park Store
listingDescription: At the park's store books, media, educational games, and other items are for retail sale that will complement the interpretive themes of the park.

images.altText: Colorful colonial glassware in front of shelves of books.
images.title: Ninety Six Park Store
images.caption: Ninety Six Park Store

bodyText:
The park store is operated by America's National Parks™, an official no-profit partner of the National Park Service dedicated to supporting the educational mission of Ninety Six National Historic Site.The park store has a wide range of books, media, educational games, and other items available for retail sale. These products complement the interpretive themes you experience when visiting the park.

The park store is located inside the Ninety Six Visitor Center, or you can visit the online park store.

The store is open during regular visitor center hours of operation.
audioDescription: As you enter through the glass double doors of the visitor center you also enter the park's store. Ahead of you is a U-shaped desk where you can pick up a park brochure, talk to a ranger or volunteer, and purchase store items. on the right and left are shelves of books and displays of educational toys, media, and other sale items.

title: Ninety Six Star Fort Pond
listingDescription: Star Fort Pond is a small lake located on the backside of Ninety Six National Historic Site.

images.altText: Two Canada Geese swim on the water at Star Fort Pond. A large tree is on the waters edge.
images.title: Geese on Star Fort Pond
images.caption: Geese on Star Fort Pond

bodyText:
Built in the 1950s by the Greenwood Mill Company, the Star Fort Pond provides the community with opportunities for fishing, hiking, and bird watching. Located on the backside of the park off Highway 246 on Kinard Road the pond can be a amazing place to enjoy nature. 

Hiking can be done year round. The Fisherman's Trail travels around the park, providing access to the lake at several points. While traveling this trail be wary of stinging and biting insects and snakes.

The Star Fort Pond is home to many species of birds, especially aquatic birds. While many of these birds, such as great blue herons, are year round residents other, such as the ruddy duck, are seasonal. 

The fishing season at the Star Fort Pond is limited from April through October. Visitors may cast a line on Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays. Fishing can be done from the bank, the fishing pier, or from a boat. Check out the fishing page to learn more about the rules and regulations.
audioDescription: A small lake formed by an earthen dam. On the lower half of the body of water is open field with small trees planted to provide shade for those fishing. The upper half is wooded with a foot path leading to areas around the waters edge. Often many birds are found either on the water or on the water's edge.

quickFacts.value: A community favorite for fishing and bird watching.
quickFacts.name: Significance
